title: Hilton: Man ‘assaults’ officer after petrol-drive off
text:
An alleged car-thief has been charged with assaulting an officer after a petrol drive-off in the western suburbs overnight.

It is alleged the 41-year-old man from Port Augusta filled up a stolen Toyota Hilux at a Hilton service station on Sir Donald Bradman Dr, but drove off without paying just after 9.30pm on Wednesday.

The car was then found parked at a nearby hotel on South Rd.

Police say the man, who was seen leaving the hotel, ran away when he saw officers approach the Hilux.

He was arrested after a short chase, during which one officer suffered a hand injury.

The 41-year-old was hit with several charges, including assaulting a prescribed emergency worker, breaching bail and illegal use.

It is believed the man stole the Hilux from a Novar Gardens address on Tuesday morning.

A 58-year-old Point Pearce man, who was the passenger, was also arrested, while the officer was treated in hospital.

Both men were refused bail and will appear in the Port Adelaide Magistrates Court today.
description: A police officer has been treated in hospital after being assaulted by an alleged car thief who is accused of stealing petrol from a western suburbs service station, police say.
